body_html: Thanks for the PR, but I think this is expected. DataParallel defined a few members itself, and we either have a choice of hiding them entirely (but some users might want to still inspect them), or shadowing the attributes of the wrapped module (silently doing the wrong thing). I'd rather not complicate this part. If you'd like to still have this behavior in your scripts, you can always write a subclass of DataParallel that implements __getattr__ as part of your code.

body: Thanks for the PR, but I think this is expected. DataParallel defined a few members itself, and we either have a choice of hiding them entirely (but some users might want to still inspect them), or shadowing the attributes of the wrapped module (silently doing the wrong thing). I'd rather not complicate this part. If you'd like to still have this behavior in your scripts, you can always write a subclass of `DataParallel` that implements `__getattr__` as part of your code.
